meanings.definition: To emphasize or make more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: She used a bright scarf to accentuate her outfit.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to accentuate the colors in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated gestures only served to accentuate the humor.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight seemed to accentuate the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent5: Adding a touch of glitter can really accentuate the sparkle of the craft project.

meanings.definition: To highlight or bring attention to.
meanings.sent1: The bold font was used to accentuate the important information.
meanings.sent2: The speaker paused to accentuate the key points of the speech.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist in the story helped to accentuate the suspense.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room seemed to accentuate the tension.
meanings.sent5: A pop of color can really accentuate the beauty of a room.

meanings.sent1: The coach always reminds the team to accentuate their strengths.
meanings.sent2: During the presentation, it's important to accentuate the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's repeated instructions only served to accentuate the confusion.
meanings.sent4: The music softly playing in the background seemed to accentuate the calm atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: To accentuate the flavor, add a pinch of salt to the dish.
